title: Dmitry Mishov, Russian airman who defected, gives BBC interview
description: Lieutenant Dmitry Mishov packed a rucksack and headed through the woods to seek asylum in Lithuania.

title: Ofsted school inspections to change after Ruth Perry's family campaign
description: Head teacher Ruth Perry took her own life after her school was downgraded.

title: Why second-hand fashion is back in style
description: "Pre-loved" clothing is big business and it is not just about saving money and the planet.

title: The women fighting Japan’s sexual violence stigma
description: Rina Gonoi was sexually assaulted when serving in Japan's army. She refused to stay silent.

title: The Ashes: 'Australia are formidable but England can beat them'
description: The World Test Championship final showed just why Australia will be formidable Ashes opponents, but also why England can beat them, says chief cricket writer Stephan Shemilt.

title: Danone boss calls for higher taxes on unhealthy food
description: Danone's UK president wants the government to use tax incentives to promote healthier products.

title: French Open 2023 final: Novak Djokovic says others must decide who is 'the greatest'
description: Novak Djokovic says it is not down to him to decide if he is the greatest men's player of all time after winning a record 23rd Grand Slam title.

title: Conor McGregor stunt: Mascots being punched 'not the brightest thing' says UFC's Dana White
description: Mascots being punched is not "the brightest thing in the world", UFC boss Dana White says after Conor McGregor reportedly injured an NBA mascot in a promotional stunt.

title: Surbiton Trophy: Andy Murray beats Jurij Rodionov to win singles title - best shots
description: Watch the best shots as Great Britain's Andy Murray beats Austria's Jurij Rodionov 6-3 6-2 to win the Surbiton Trophy singles title.

title: Surbiton Trophy 2023 results: Andy Murray beats Jurij Rodionov to claim grass-court title
description: Britain's Andy Murray claims his first grass-court singles title for seven years with victory over Jurij Rodionov in the Surbiton Trophy final.

title: French Open 2023 results: Novak Djokovic beats Casper Ruud to win Paris title and claim 23rd major
description: Novak Djokovic shows his greatness once again by beating Casper Ruud to win the French Open and claim a men's record 23rd Grand Slam title.

title: Police release Nicola Sturgeon without charge
description: Ms Sturgeon says she is "innocent of any wrongdoing" after being released while more inquiries are carried out.

title: Michael Travis Leake, US musician, detained in Russia
description: Michael Travis Leake has been accused of selling drugs to young people, but denies the charges.

title: Kherson flooding: Ukraine evacuation boat attacked by Russia, killing three
description: Hundreds of people have been trapped on the Russia-held eastern bank of the Dnipro River.

title: Nicola Sturgeon's arrest over SNP finances - in 80 seconds
description: Scotland's former first minister was questioned by police before being released without charge pending further investigations.

title: Paul Scully fails to make London mayor shortlist
description: The shortlist was drawn up following interviews by a selection panel at Conservative party headquarters.

title: Manchester City: Treble winners welcomed home by fans after Champions League victory
description: Manchester City are welcomed home by fans as they arrive back in the UK from Istanbul after winning the Champions League for the first time.

title: How four children survived 40 days in hostile jungle
description: The youngsters defied the odds in a part of the Amazon rainforest home to jaguars and wild dogs.

title: French Open 2023: Novak Djokovic's record-breaking dominance in numbers
description: BBC Sport looks at the numbers behind Novak Djokovic's dominant professional career as he becomes the first man to win 23 Grand Slam titles.

title: Premier 15s: Exeter Chiefs 24-21 Saracens - Late try gives hosts thrilling semi-final win
description: Exeter score with two minutes left on the clock to reach a second successive Premier 15s final, ending Saracens' perfect semi-finals record.

title: Philadelphia Interstate 95 freeway partially collapses following underpass fire
description: Aerial images show the partial disintegration caused by an oil tanker fire underneath the I-95 highway.

title: Bath stabbing: Eight teens arrested after boy, 16, killed
description: Six boys and two girls, aged between 15 and 17, are arrested on suspicion of murder in Bath.

title: Manchester City fans celebrate historic Treble win
description: Thousands gathered at live screenings where they watched the Blues secure the Treble.

title: Three Britons missing after Egypt boat fire
description: Twelve other Britons were rescued after a fire on a boat which was on a cruise in the Egyptian Red Sea.

title: Country doesn't miss drama of Boris Johnson, says Shapps
description: The energy secretary dismisses Boris Johnson's claim that he was the victim of a "witch hunt".

title: World Test Championship: Australia beat India in final at The Oval
description: Australia win the World Test Championship by ruthlessly dismantling India on the fifth day of the final at The Oval.

title: Ukraine war: Russia moves to take direct control of Wagner Group
description: It appears to be the latest in a public falling out between the Wagner boss and Russian officials.

title: Tour Feminin des Pyrenees abandoned because of safety concerns
description: The Tour Feminin des Pyrenees in south-west France is called off abandoned by the Union Cycliste Internationale (UCI) after two stages because of safety concerns.

title: Daviot wildfire burns next to back garden amid power cuts
description: One local man told the BBC his family had left their Highlands property as the flames were so close by.

title: 'Man City among the greatest sides I have seen - but who are yours?'
description: Following Manchester City's Treble, Phil McNulty reflects on the greatest football sides he has ever seen and asks you for your suggestions.

title: Powys: Man spends 60 years pulling pints behind same bar
description: When John Williams started out as a barman at Tŷ Brith six decades ago, a pint cost just 11p.

title: Donald Trump still headline act for Republicans, despite charges
description: The former US president appeared unfazed by his indictment at a party convention in North Carolina.

title: Newhaven: Man charged with couple's murder after bodies found
description: Derek Martin, 64, also known as Derek Glenn, of Brighton, is charged with two counts of murder.

title: Canadian Open: Rory McIlroy, Tommy Fleetwood & Justin Rose two off lead
description: Rory McIlroy is two shots off the lead alongside Tommy Fleetwood and Justin Rose as he chases a third consecutive Canadian Open title.

title: Manchester City: The big numbers behind the Treble
description: One season, 60 games, 44 wins, 149 goals and three major trophies - BBC Sport looks at the numbers behind Manchester City's best season.

title: Pigeon racing: The young fanciers keeping the sport alive
description: Some third-generation pigeon fanciers are picking up top awards and ensuring the future of racing.

title: Don't block Boris Johnson returning to Parliament, Jacob Rees-Mogg warns Tories
description: The party risks "civil war" if the ex-PM is ever stopped from returning to Parliament, Mr Rees-Mogg says.

title: Josh Taylor v Teofimo Lopez: Scot loses WBO super-lightweight title in New York
description: Josh Taylor has his final world title wrenched away as Teofimo Lopez outpoints him to become WBO super-lightweight champion.

title: Thunderstorms expected in parts of UK after hottest day of year
description: A yellow warning for thunderstorms is in place for many parts of the UK on Sunday.

title: Gladiator sequel crew members injured in stunt sequence on set
description: The crew members are receiving medical treatment after the accident while filming in Morocco.

title: Illegal Migration Bill breaches human rights obligations, MPs and peers warn
description: Most refugees coming to the UK would be denied access to the asylum system under the law, MPs and peers warn.
